ARABIC: وَمِنْهُم مَّن يَنظُرُ إِلَيْكَ أَفَأَنتَ تَهْدِى ٱلْعُمْىَ وَلَوْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يُبْصِرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Among them there are some who look at you. But can you guide the blind, even though they cannot see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Some of them look toward you: But can you show the blind the way even when they cannot see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And of them some look towards you; will you, then, guide the blind, even though they can see nothing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Some of them will look at you, but are you supposed to guide the blind even if they have no vision?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And among them is one who gazes at you; so will you guide the blind* even if they cannot perceive? (* Deaf or blind to guidance.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And among them are some who look at you, but can you guide the blind -- even though they see not
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And there are those of them who look at you, but can you show the way to the blind though they will not see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And some of them look unto thee; what, wilt thou then guide the blind, though they do not see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And of them is he who looketh toward thee. But canst thou guide the blind even though they see not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Some of them look fixedly at you; but can you make the blind see, bereft as they are of sight?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And of them are some who look at thee, so canst thou guide the blind, even though they see not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: There are some of them who observe you. But can you guide the blind even if they do not perceive?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And among them are some who look at thee: but canst thou guide the blind,- even though they will not see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And among them are some who look at you, but can you guide the blind, even though they see not?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Some of them look to you. But can you guide the blind, even though they do not see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind, even though they do not see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [10:43] And of them are some who look toward you. But will you guide the blind, even though they do not see? — He likens them [the Meccan disbelievers] to these [the blind] because they fail to be guided, nay, [they are] much worse [since God says]: It is not the eyes that are blind, but blind are the hearts within the breasts [Q. 22:46].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And of them) of the Jews; and it is said: of the idolaters (is he who looketh towards you. But canst thou guide) lead to guidance (the blind even though they see not) even though they do not desire to see the Truth and guidance?
